bringsDoomCloser.description: What brings your doom closer? Choose two.

doomedSanctuaryDownsides.description: Choose two downsides of your sanctuary:

theProtegeMentorsResources.description: Choose up to three resources that your mentor gave you and the team:

advancements.label: Advancements
advancements.description: When you fill your potential track, you advance. Choose from the list below.

laterAdvances.label: Later Advances
laterAdvances.description: When you’ve taken five advances from the top list, you can take advances from the list below.

teamQuestion.label: When our team first came together...

system.description: When you comfort or support someone, roll + Mundane.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: Mark Potential and the GM makes a move.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value: They hear you: they mark potential, clear a condition, or shift Labels if they open up to you.

success.label: Success!
success.value: They hear you: they mark potential, clear a condition, or shift Labels if they open up to you. You can also add a Team to the pool or clear a condition yourself.

system.description: When you defend someone or something from an immediate threat, roll + Savior.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: Mark Potential and the GM makes a move.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value:
For NPC threats:

You Keep them safe and choose one. But it costs you: expose yourself to danger or escalate the situation.

  • Add a Team to the pool

  • @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.JournalEntry.w5RMQhyRMu0Kz8Bh.JournalEntryPage.UQp2JmzBob2lVP3C]{Clear a Condition}

 

For PC threats:

Give them -2 to their roll.

You Expose yourself to cost, retribution, or judgment

system.description: When you provoke someone susceptible to your words, say what you’re trying to get them to do and roll + Superior.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: Mark Potential and the GM makes a move.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value:
For NPCs:

Choose one:

    • They stumble: you take +1 forward against them
    • They err: you gain a critical opportunity
    • They overreact: you gain influence over them

 

For PCs:

Choose one.

  • If they do it, add a Team to the pool
  • If they don’t do it, they mark a condition

success.label: Success!
success.value:
For NPCs:

They rise to the bait and do what you want.

 

For PCs:

Both. 

  • If they do it, add a Team to the pool
  • If they don’t do it, they mark a condition

system.description: When you stand up for something, roll + Savior.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: Mark Potential and the GM makes a move.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value:
Choose one.

  • Listeners can’t keep doing what they’re doing
  • Listeners can’t flee without addressing you
  • Listeners can’t attack you without losing status or position

success.label: Success!
success.value:
Choose two.

  • Listeners can’t keep doing what they’re doing
  • Listeners can’t flee without addressing you
  • Listeners can’t attack you without losing status or position

system.description: When you unleash your powers to overcome an obstacle, reshape your environment, or extend your senses, roll + Freak.

failure.label: Complications...

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value: You do it. Mark a condition or the GM will tell you how the effect is  Unstable or Temporary.

system.description: When you take a powerful blow, roll + conditions marked.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: You stand strong. Mark potential as normal, and say how you weather the blow.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value:
Choose one:

  • Lashing out verbally: provoke a teammate to foolhardy action or take advantage of your Influence to inflict a condition
  • Giving ground: your opposition gets an opportunity
  • Struggling past the pain mark two conditions

success.label: Success!
success.value:
Choose one:

  • You must remove yourself from the situation: flee, pass out, etc.
  • You lose control of yourself or your powers in a terrible way
  • Two options from this list:
    • Lashing out verbally: provoke a teammate to foolhardy action or take advantage of your Influence to inflict a condition
    • Giving ground: your opposition gets an opportunity
    • Struggling past the pain: mark two conditions

system.description:
Anyone on the team can spend a Team out of the pool to give a teammate +1 on a move, after the roll. To do this, the spender has to be able to actually help—if you’re in a completely different place from your teammate, then you can’t spend Team to help, unless it makes sense in the fiction (a telepathic connection, maybe).

Multiple teammates can spend Team from the pool to help on the same roll—even low rolls can be turned into hits when the whole group pitches in and there’s enough Team in the pool.

But each teammate can only spend one Team out of the pool for any single roll, and they still have to be able to actually help in the fiction.

NPCs who are part of the team, whether temporarily or permanently, can also help. Players can spend Team from the pool on behalf of those NPCs. The players still have to spend one Team per NPC who helps, and the NPCs still have to be fictionally capable of helping. If the GM thinks the NPC wouldn’t help, then they won’t.

When you act selfishly, say how your actions ignore or insult your teammates, remove one Team from the pool, and shift one Label up and one Label down, your choice.

You can use this option after rolling to alter the Label you’re rolling with.

Because you can act selfishly after you roll, this can boost a miss up to a hit, or a partial hit up to a full hit, by changing the Label you rolled with. All you have to do is spend the Team from the pool and describe your character doing something that ignores or insults your teammates.

Generally, your teammates can determine whether they feel ignored or insulted by the selfish action, but the GM can push on it if it seems appropriate.

Acting selfishly may save you when you can’t be helped by anybody else, but it has a cost you can’t avoid.

At the start of every session, the GM adds one Team to the pool.

At the end of every session, choose one:

  • Grow closer to the team. Explain who made you feel welcome; give Influence to that character and clear a condition or mark potential.
  • Grow into your own image of yourself. Explain how you see yourself and why; shift one Label up and another down.
  • Grow away from the team. Explain why you feel detached. Take Influence over you away from another character.

When you have Influence over someone, take +1 to all moves targeting them, including rejecting their Influence.

 

When you take advantage of this Influence, surrender the Influence you hold over them to choose one:

  • Inflict a condition on them, your choice.
  • They take -2 on a move they just made (after their roll).
  • Take an additional +1 on a move targeting them (after your roll).

 

If you have Influence over a teammate and you would gain Influence over them again, immediately shift one of their Labels up and one of their Labels down, your choice.

 

If you have Influence over an NPC and you would gain Influence over them again, take +1 forward against them.

When someone with Influence over you tells you who you are or how the world works, accept what they say or reject their Influence. If you accept what they say, the GM will adjust your Labels accordingly; if you want to keep your Labels as they are, you must reject their Influence.

 

When you reject someone’s Influence, roll.

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: Their words hit you hard. Mark a condition, and the GM adjusts your Labels.

partial.label: Partial success
partial.value:
You successfully hold to yourself and tune them out. Choose one.

  • Clear a condition or mark potential by immediately acting to prove them wrong
  • Shift one Label up and one Label down, your choice
  • Cancel their Influence and take +1 forward against them

success.label: Success!
success.value:
You successfully hold to yourself and tune them out. Choose two.

  • Clear a condition or mark potential by immediately acting to prove them wrong
  • Shift one Label up and one Label down, your choice
  • Cancel their Influence and take +1 forward against them

system.description:
When you enter battle against a dangerous foe as a team, add two to the Team pool.

  • If the leader has Influence over every teammate, add another Team.
  • If everyone has the same purpose in the fight, add another Team.
  • If any team member mistrusts the leader or the team, remove a Team.
  • If your team is ill-prepared or off-balance, remove a Team.

The leader of the team can mark a condition to avoid removing a Team from the pool.
